questionText: Noah was a ______ man, blameless among the people of his time, and he walked faithfully with God.
Now the earth was ______ in God’s sight and was full of violence.
God saw how corrupt the earth had become, for all the people on earth had ______ their ways.
So God said to Noah, 'I am going to put an ______ to all people, for the earth is filled with violence because of them.'
So make yourself an ark of ______ wood; make rooms in it and coat it with pitch inside and out.
This is how you are to build it: The ark is to be three hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide and ______ cubits high.
Noah did ______ just as God commanded him.
By faith Noah, when warned about things not yet seen, in holy fear built an ark to ______ his family.
You are to bring into the ark ______ of all living creatures, male and female, to keep them alive with you.
Two of every kind of bird, of every kind of animal and of every kind of creature that moves along the ground will come to you to be ______ alive.
Pairs of clean and unclean animals, of birds and of all creatures that move along the ground, male and female, came to Noah and entered the ark, as God had ______ Noah.
The Lord then said to Noah, 'Go into the ark, you and your whole family, because I have found you ______ in this generation.'
And Noah did ______ that the Lord commanded him.
And Noah and his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives entered the ark to ______ the waters of the flood.
And after the seven days the floodwaters came ______.
And rain fell on the earth ______ days and ______ nights.
For forty days the flood kept coming on the earth, and as the waters increased they ______ the ark high above the earth.
But God ______ Noah and all the wild animals and the livestock that were with him in the ark...
I have set my ______ in the clouds, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and the earth.
I will remember my covenant between me and you and all living creatures of every kind. Never again will the waters become a flood to ______ all life.
